name: DetectionEvaluationJ
body:
DetectionEvaluationJ is an [ImageJ](https://imagej.nih.gov/) plugin that has been designed to evaluate the performance of object detection algorithms using several metrics. From a set of images, the gold standard associated with such images, and the detected regions obtained by the detection algorithm, DetectionEvaluationJ generates a report that summarises the performance of the detection algorithm based on the available measures.

DetectionEvaluationJ is free to use and licensed under the license GNU GPL 3.0.

### Download
You can download DetectionEvaluationJ from [here](https://github.com/joheras/DetectionEvaluationJ/blob/master/dist/DetectionEvaluationJ_.jar). 

### Dependencies
[ImageJ](https://imagej.nih.gov/) or [Fiji](https://fiji.sc/).

### Installation
1. Download and install either ImageJ or Fiji.
2. Download the [DetectionEvaluationJ](https://github.com/joheras/DetectionEvaluationJ/blob/master/dist/DetectionEvaluationJ_.jar).
3. Put the jar file downloaded in the previous step into your ImageJ/Fiji plugins folder.

After restarting ImageJ/Fiji, you will find the option IJ-OpenCV under the plugins menu. That submenu contains the plugins developed with this library.

### Usage example

### Source files
The source code of DetectionEvaluationJ is also freely available at the following [github page](https://github.com/joheras/DetectionEvaluationJ).
